thread.title: Kellie Maloney shows off new fresh-faced look as she prepares to reinvent herself as a pub landlady
thread.title_full: Kellie Maloney shows off new fresh-faced look as she prepares to reinvent herself as a pub landlady

author: Jessica Gibb
title: Kellie Maloney shows off new fresh-faced look as she prepares to reinvent herself as a pub landlady
text:
Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Boxing promoter Kellie Maloney showed off her new fresh-faced look as she left a pub in Kent this afternoon. 
The reality star, 62, looked like her time away from our screens has done her the world of good. 
Wearing grey skinny jeans with a casual jacket and a butterfly-print scarf, Kellie looked relaxed and happy as she left the boozer in Marden. 
And it seems Kellie, formerly known as Frank, is considering a change of career as she reportedly plans to take over a pub. Kellie Maloney leaves The Unicorn Pub Marden Kent Yesterday (Photo: JIM BENNETT) 
She is said to be in talks to take over The Unicorn pub in April. 
"She sees a lot of potential in The Unicorn and wants to get a normal life away from the spotlight," a source told Kent Online . 
"She's hoping to revamp the pub but does not want it to lose any of its charm." 
Kellie completed her gender reassignment surgery last year, after living as a woman for two years prior to her final operation. 
Last year, she returned to the boxing world as a promoter and released an autobiography documenting her transitioning. Kellie Maloney leaves The Unicorn Pub Marden Kent Yesterday (Photo: JIM BENNETT) 
She was due to appear on the celebrity edition of First Dates last year but it was pulled – because the man she was paired with felt “uncomfortable” with her being transgender . 
The boxing promoter was set to appear on the Channel 4 show at the end of last year. 
But the man paired with Kellie by producers had a change of heart after their “date” and demanded producers spike the footage. 
A source close to Kellie said: “The man seemed very taken aback during the date and it was clear he wasn’t very happy afterwards.” Kellie Maloney leaves The Unicorn Pub Marden Kent Yesterday (Photo: JIM BENNETT) 
Channel4 insisted the un-named man was asked before the date whether he was “open to being paired with a transgender person”, to which he replied yes. 
Maloney announced publicly in 2014 that she wished to be known as Kellie and in April 2015 she announced that her gender transition was now complete. 
The Sunday Mirror revealed in a candid interview with Kellie in August 2014 her torment over years of living a lie and the battle to come to terms with her gender identity. Like us on Facebook
